Description: The hollow terracotta head of a bearded man, broken from a figure. The hair recedes at the temples, but is otherwise thick and curly. It may be a portrait, but there is an element of caricature. It is modelled front and back. Two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, second century AD. Comparandum: Near: Petrie Museum uc47862, from Memphis.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3585)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
